title: Iowans Fault DNC for Role in Caucus Debacle
summary: A report says the DNC demanded late changes to the reporting system Iowa Democrats planned to use. The Iowa Democratic Party released a report Saturday that said late technology demands from the Democratic National Committee contributed to a caucus results-reporting debacle that marred the start of the presidential nomination process.

title: Pfizer-BioNTech Shot Recommended for CDC Immunization Schedule
summary: Addition to the federal public health agency's list would mean insurance can cover the shots. An expert panel recommended the U.S. government add the newly authorized Covid-19 vaccine from Pfizer Inc. and BioNTech SE to a list of inoculations people 16 years and older should get.

title: Singer Charley Pride Dies at Age 86
summary: The singer won three Grammy Awards and had more than 30 No. 1 hits between 1969 and 1984. Charley Pride, country music's first Black superstar whose rich baritone on such hits as "Kiss an Angel Good Morning" helped sell millions of records and made him the first Black member of the Country Music Hall of Fame, has died. He was 86 years old.

title: Photos of the Week
summary: A selection of photos from Dec. 6 through Dec. 12 by The Wall Street Journal's photo editors. A Biocad factory in St. Petersburg, Russia, where scientists are racing to transform small amounts of a Covid-19 vaccine into tens of millions of doses. "Scaling is a complex process," said Dmitry Morozov, Biocad's chief executive. "What was effective in the lab may not be replicated in large volumes." Russia is struggling to make the promised doses of Its Sputnik V vaccine and turning to private drug companies like Biocad as equipment problems and technical challenges hit year-end manufacturing targets. Read more.

title: How the Covid Pandemic Will Change Online Dating
summary: Helen Fisher says people not only have gotten used to video dates. They like them.. Five questions with Helen Fisher, biological anthropologist, chief scientific adviser to dating site Match and author of "Anatomy of Love."

title: Affirm Delays Its IPO
summary: The point-of-sale lender is the second company in as many days to pull back from the IPO market. Affirm Holdings Inc. is postponing its initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter, the second company in as many days to pull back from the red-hot IPO market.

title: Marcus Samuelsson on Restaurants in 2020: Fear, Change-and Hope
summary: Resume Subscription. This year, the restaurant industry was flipped on its head. Covid-19 disrupted our way of life, throwing everyone in the supply chain-from the farmers who grow our food to the chefs who turn it into the masterful dishes that end up on our plates-into a season of disarray and fear.

title: AstraZeneca's Alexion Splurge Could Attract a Crowd
summary: The drug giant's bid for rare-disease specialist Alexion should please shareholders if the company doesn't find itself in a bidding war. AstraZeneca 's $39 billion splurge to acquire Alexion Pharmaceuticals looks like a winner-as long as it can hang on at that price tag.

title: What-and How-People Were Reading During Covid-19
summary: Many library patrons discovered e-books and audiobooks for the first time. They're sticking with them.. Five questions with Steve Potash, founder and chief executive officer of OverDrive Inc., a free service offered by libraries and schools that lets people borrow e-books and audiobooks. The company supplies approximately 90% of public libraries in North America.

title: NFL Ratings Drop Leaves Networks Scrambling to Make Advertisers Whole
summary: TV networks are using ad inventory to make good on their earlier audience commitments. A pro football game on a Wednesday afternoon is rare. Advertisers getting a pricing discount for NFL games is also usually unheard of.

title: AstraZeneca Agrees to Buy Alexion for $39 Billion
summary: The deal would bolster the British drug giant's footprint in rare diseases. LONDON- AstraZeneca PLC said it agreed to buy Boston-based Alexion Pharmaceuticals Inc. for $39 billion in cash and stock, a move that would bolster the British drug giant's footprint in rare diseases.

title: The Best Television of 2020: Binge-Watching Our Way Through Quarantine
summary: Shut in at home, many of us had more time than ever to watch great TV-and there was more than enough of it, from 'I May Destroy You' to 'The Queen's Gambit.'. The first show I reviewed in 2020 was the Netflix miniseries "Dracula," which now seems like a foreshadowing too obvious even for a 19th-century potboiler. As in any adaptation of the 1897 Bram Stoker novel, vampirism was a kind of contagion; intimacy could be lethal; evil was poised to go viral; death lay in the story's DNA. It's probably fortunate, for both the series and the critic, that this "Dracula" preceded the explosions of the pandemic, because Covid-19 would have been perceived as lurking around every Transylvanian corner.

title: The Year Wildfires in the West Spread Like the Plague
summary: Resume Subscription. Surely the dominant story of 2020 will be the coronavirus pandemic and the economic upheaval and political fallout it caused. But the enduring images of the year may well be of another contagion-the fires that splashed across the globe and the havoc they wrought where humanity's and nature's economies met.

title: Jay Leno on How Driving Changed in 2020-and How It Will Change Even More
summary: The comedian and car lover offers his predictions for electric cars and driverless technology. As told to The Wall Street Journal

title: Trump Eyes Special Counsel for Election, Hunter Biden
summary: President has expressed frustration with Attorney General William Barr as efforts to overturn election have failed. President Trump has expressed interest in pursuing the appointment of a special counsel to investigate allegations of fraud in the November elections and issues related to Hunter Biden, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: What the WSJ Management Top 250 Rankings Measure-and How Well
summary: The model does a good job gauging 'effectiveness,' as defined by Peter Drucker, and the underlying factors that influence it. When the Drucker Institute began building the model behind the Management Top 250 six years ago, we had no idea whether it would pan out.

title: Warning Signs in the Best-Managed Companies
summary: These companies score well overall in the WSJ Management Top 250. But there are red flags in at least one area.. Facebook raked in more than $21 billion in revenue in the third quarter, has upward of 50,000 employees, and more than three billion people use at least one of its products in any given month. But it came in dead last in customer satisfaction among the top 100 U.S. companies in this year's Management Top 250 ranking, drawn down in part by a low net promoter score-which shows customers' willingness to recommend the company-from J.D. Power.

title: What's New in the WSJ Management Top 250 Rankings for 2020
summary: Some of the changes were substantial; some were minor tweaks. But they all aim to bolster the model's empirical validity.. As you digest the Management Top 250 for 2020, seeing which companies landed where on the list, our heads are already off in a different place: thinking about the rankings for 2021.

title: The Best-Managed Companies of 2020-and How They Got That Way
summary: Microsoft is on top, followed by Apple, IBM and Amazon in the Drucker Institute's annual Management Top 250 ranking. The technology giants that shape so much of our lives dominate in yet another way: They lead the pack of the country's best-run companies.

title: Explore the Management Top 250
summary: Resume Subscription. The Management Top 250 ranking, developed by the Drucker Institute, measures corporate effectiveness by examining performance in five areas: customer satisfaction, employee engagement and development, innovation, social responsibility and financial strength. The ranking is based on an analysis of 33 data inputs provided by 14 third-party sources.

title: Dividends Will Have Their Day Again
summary: Dividend-paying stocks haven't been superstars lately and in theory they shouldn't be, but companies that pay them could shine once more. What do you call an investment strategy that would have left the likes of Amazon , Facebook , Tesla , Netflix and Google parent Alphabet out of your portfolio?

title: Methodology for the Management Top 250 Company Rankings
summary: How the Drucker Institute identified the most effectively managed U.S. companies. The Management Top 250 ranking is based on a holistic measure of corporate "effectiveness" that was developed by the Drucker Institute, a part of Claremont Graduate University in Claremont, Calif. "Effectiveness" is defined as "doing the right things well."

title: Shutting Borders Helped Australia Contain Covid-19. Now Reopening Them Is Proving Difficult.
summary: The country wants to roll back some of the strictest domestic travel restrictions in the world, but many people wish they would stay in place. SYDNEY-A Qantas flight was en route to Western Australia last month when the captain relayed bad news: A Covid-19 case in South Australia, the first community infection in seven months, had led authorities to shut the state border at their destination.

title: New York City Students Get Early Assist in Saving for College
summary: NYC Kids RISE program is helping more than 10,000 students in schools in western Queens with funds. Rahimuzzaman Sumon was out of work this spring as an Uber driver because of the coronavirus pandemic and relied on unemployment to support his wife and two children. But he still put away money into his daughter's college-savings account.

title: How 79-Year-Old Martha Stewart Stays Zoom-Ready
summary: The indefatigable mogul describes her approach to beauty, wellness, social media and aging. She's a fan of CBD products and ring lights.. Off Brand is a thrice-monthly column that delves into trends in women's fashion and beauty.

title: 'Working Together: The Photographers of the Kamoinge Workshop' Review: A Black Community Too Long Forgotten
summary: An exhibition at the Whitney gathers the work of a Black collective from the 1960s and '70s who sought to counter racial stereotypes through their luminous photography.. New York

title: Concerts for a Covid Christmas
summary: Several choirs and ensembles in England and the U.S. are offering virtual performances this holiday season, including renditions of Handel's 'Messiah.'.

title: For One Prized Italian Tradition, Covid-19 Deals Heartbreaking Blow
summary: Artisans clustered along a Naples street have been crafting Nativity scenes for more than a century. But coronavirus restrictions and a dearth of tourists are threatening their survival..

title: When the Robinhood Crowd Buys for the Long Haul
summary: Some new investors are using fractional-share buying programs as a way to get broad exposure to stocks through exchange-traded funds. Fractional shares are an easy way for small investors to buy a piece of Tesla or Apple , but many are using it as a way to slowly accumulate exchange-traded funds that give them a small piece of the broader market.

title: Gargling Could Slow Covid-19 Spread, Mouthwash Makers Say
summary: Mouthwash could deactivate the coronavirus in the mouth, company studies show, but some question lab findings' impact on real-life transmission. Wash your hands, wear a mask and don't forget to gargle with mouthwash.

title: Supreme Court Rejects Texas Challenge to Biden's Victory
summary: Lawsuit was President Trump's last chance to overturn election results before Electoral College meets. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court rejected on Friday Texas's long-shot bid to void 20 million votes in four other states, clearing the path for Joe Biden's victory when presidential electors meet Monday in state capitals across the nation.

title: How Autism and Invention Are Connected
summary: Our unique ability to analyze patterns is at the root of a psychological disability and the talent that drives human development. On the face of it, we shouldn't expect any link between a neurological disability and one of the crowning talents of our species. But new research is revealing a surprising connection between autism and the uniquely human capacity for invention.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Intel Not Inside: How Mobile Chips Overtook the Semiconductor Giant
summary: Resume Subscription. Intel Corp. , once the dominant designer and manufacturer of microchips at the core of nearly all personal and cloud computing, has for years been losing ground to competitors. Hardly a ragtag bunch, the opposition now includes trillion-dollar companies alongside countless startups, and it's well on its way to wrecking Intel's hegemony.
